stepTitle:
For the element sulfur, consider the forms yellow sulfur (rhombic) and monoclinic sulfur. Given the following standard entropies and enthalpies of formation, determine which allotrope is thermodynamically more stable at $$298$$ K using the Gibbs free energy formula:

S (yellow): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$31.88$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
S (monoclinic): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0.30$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$32.60$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
choices: Temperature plays no role in the stability of these allotropes.
